Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label one land habitat, such as a playground or forest, and include at least three different kinds of living things like trees, squirrels, and ants.
The student can draw and label one water habitat, such as a pond or stream, and include at least three different kinds of living things like fish, clams, and water plants.
The student can show a variety of plants and animals in each habitat to demonstrate differences in biodiversity.
The student can illustrate patterns of where different types of living things commonly live, like how some animals only appear in water habitats and others on land.
The student can identify and label each living thing in their drawing to show understanding of how they fit into the habitat.
